title: Sanjun Gu Grafting Farmers Forum Presentation 2012

subtasks: Cutting rootstock plants to specific sizes
Creating a grafting interface by cutting rootstock at a 45-degree angle
Positioning scion on rootstock with a grafting tube
Sealing graft union with grafting tape
Curing grafted plants under controlled light and humidity conditions
Monitoring graft union healing and adjusting environmental conditions as needed
Transplanting grafted plants into high tunnels
Comparing high tunnel poly layers (single vs. double layer) and their impact on grafted heirloom tomato growth
Measuring stem diameter of grafted vs. non-grafted plants to assess vigor
Analyzing survival rates of grafted heirloom tomatoes in the field
Considering the influence of rootstock on soil-borne disease resistance
Assessing the potential benefits of grafted tomatoes in high tunnel environments
